item.description: <p>E﻿rika Kirk, Charlie Kirk&#x27;s widow, vowed to continue his controversial &quot;work&quot; at the White House ceremony.</p>

item.title: Australia Post reveals deadline for mailing Christmas parcels
item.description: <p>With the festive season almost upon us, Australia Post ﻿is encouraging Australians to plan ahead to ensure their parcels arrive on time.</p>

item.title: US strikes another boat accused of carrying drugs off Venezuela, killing six
item.description: <p>U﻿S President Donald Trump said he authorised the attack against &#x27;narcoterrorists&#x27; on the vessel.</p>

item.title: Controversial US commentator Candace Owens loses bid to enter Australia
item.description: <p>Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke refused the far-right firebrand&#x27;s visa in October 2024 on the basis she would &quot;incite discord&quot; ahead of a planned speaking tour.</p>

item.title: New ABS figures show Australians are waiting longer to have children
item.description: <p>The median age of mothers and fathers increased last year, according to new government figures.</p>

item.title: Renewed search for missing boy Gus in SA outback to be 'restricted' by extreme heat
item.description: <p>Temperatures are forecast to reach tops of 36 degrees in the ﻿Yunta area tomorrow.</p>

item.title: Western Sydney man charged for allegedly sending $650k to sanctioned Iranian banks
item.description: <p>I﻿t comes as Australia&#x27;s relationship with Iran becomes more tense.</p>

item.title: US President Donald Trump calls out Time magazine for photo
item.description: <p>Donald Trump has said he believes <em>Time</em> magazine &quot;deserves to be called out&quot; for running a &quot;super bad&quot; picture of him.</p>

item.title: Media outlets, including Fox News and pro-Trump Newsmax, refuse to sign Pentagon's press access rules
item.description: <p>Virtually every news outlet is rejecting the ultimatum and saying they will not sign.</p>

item.title: 'He's very honest and open': Perth venue boss says deported British personality wasn't to be paid for meet and
item.description: <p>John &quot;Big John&quot; Fisher arrived in Perth overnight for several meet and greet events with fans – but said he wasn&#x27;t allowed to enter the country.</p>

item.title: Why nearly 12 million Aussies plan to spend less than ever before this Christmas
item.description: <p>A third of Aussies also say they are feeling the pressure of extra holiday expenses on top of everyday spending</p>

item.title: World's oldest president bids to hold onto power in Cameroon election
item.description: <p>O﻿pposition leaders are claiming a victory in the presidential poll, but 92-year-old Paul Biya is refusing to stand down.</p>

item.title: Question marks still surround revamped super tax despite government U-turn
item.description: <p>The federal government&#x27;s U-turn over the more contentious elements of its superannuation tax overhaul might have been widely welcomed, but it is still facing a number of questions over the revised laws.</p>
